page.title: 04Cranshaws Forestry
page.content: Forestry accounts for some 24 percent of the ground cover in this 12km block. About 20 privately owned small blocks of woodland are integrated with the agriculture & the NE corner of the area includes C.200 hectares of a large block of production forest planted in 1983. Smaller woods provide shelter for farm stock game & wildlife & will provide a significant volume of timber. The plantations are mostly coniferous less than 40 years of age. Several are in the thinning stages & producing a first crop of timber which is sold mainly to chipwood pulpwood markets. A small proportion is used for fuel. The woods therefore form an important part of the ecology of the area & along with neighbouring blocks provide employment locally. Total area of woodland in this area is C.290 hectares.
